meanings.definition: A person who appeases or seeks to pacify someone or a group by giving in to their demands.
meanings.sent1: The appeasers tried to calm the angry mob by agreeing to their demands.
meanings.sent2: The appeasers in the negotiation room were willing to compromise to avoid conflict.
meanings.sent3: The appeasers at the party kept offering snacks to keep everyone happy.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the appeaser of the family, always giving in to keep peace.
meanings.sent5: The appeasers in the village were praised for their ability to resolve disputes peacefully.

meanings.definition: The act of appeasing or attempting to satisfy someone's desires or demands.
meanings.sent1: The appeasers of the situation quickly offered a solution to avoid further conflict.
meanings.sent2: His constant appeasers to his boss's demands eventually led to a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The appeasers of the hungry children brought out a tray of cookies to calm them down.
meanings.sent4: Her appeasers to the customer's complaints only seemed to make them more upset.
meanings.sent5: The appeasers of the angry customer included a discount on their next purchase.
